description: Ned +‎ -y, Ned being a diminutive of Edward.

entries.meaning: (UK, Australia, slang) A horse, especially a racehorse.
examples: Some of the boys whipped off their hats and laughingly smacked their neddies′ rumps, for we hated using spurs on the poor thirsty beggars.

entries.meaning: (Australia, slang, in the plural, with "the") The horse races.
examples: He′d usually be there at the same place most Saturdays and we ended up sharing a beer talking about the neddies. It just grew from there. I′d nod at him; ask him how he was going. We′d talk racing, have a dig at each other for backing losers.

entries.meaning: (Australia, colloquial, slang, usually in the plural) Horsepower.
An idiot; a stupid or contemptible person.
examples: The trouble is that the neddies in the Board of Trade would probably approve it.

entries.meaning: (Tyneside, obsolete) Alternative form of netty: an outhouse; a lavatory; a toilet.
examples: Neddy, Netty, a certain place that will not bear a written explanation, but which is depicted to the very life in a tail-piece in the first edition of Bewick's ‘Land Birds’ (1797), p. 285.
